metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1154 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use after free in utf_ptr2char in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4646.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-athena - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-athena-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-gnome-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-gtk-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-gtk3 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-gtk3-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-nox - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-nox-py2 - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ccdm94> in bionic and earlier, vulnerable function is in file src/regexp.c instead of file src/regexp_bt.c.

criterions.comment: vim package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.1689-3ubuntu1.5+esm4').
